title: Guy Mannering, Or, the Astrologer - Complete
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Now, if ye let me stay quietly here the night wi'the Captain, I'se pay ye double fees for the room; and if ye sayno, ye shall hae the best sark-fu' o' sair banes that ever ye hadin your life the first time ye set a foot by Liddel Moat!'

title: Guy Mannering, Or, the Astrologer - Complete
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: An' I forgat to tell ye, there's been anunco inquiry after the auld wife that we saw in Bewcastle; theSheriff's had folk ower the Limestane Edge after her, and down theHermitage and Liddel, and a' gates, and a reward offered for herto appear o' fifty pound sterling, nae less; and Justice Forster,he's had out warrants, as I am tell'd, in Cumberland; and an uncoranging and ripeing they have had a' gates seeking for her; butshe'll no be taen wi' them unless she likes, for a' that.'

title: Guy Mannering, Or, the Astrologer - Complete
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: 'Ou, we have nae connexion at a' wi' the Bertrams,' said Dandie;'they were grand folk by the like o' us; but Jean Liltup, that wasauld Singleside's housekeeper, and the mother of these twa youngladies that are gane--the last o' them's dead at a ripe age, Itrow--Jean Liltup came out o' Liddel water, and she was as nearour connexion as second cousin to my mother's half-sister.

title: Guy Mannering, Or, the Astrologer - Complete
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: 'We will correct that quality,' answered King Paulus, the first ofthe name; 'we have not forgotten that the moist and humid air ofour valley of Liddel inclines to stronger potations.

title: Guy Mannering, Or, the Astrologer - Complete
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: After a week spent in rural sport, and distinguished by the mostfrank attentions on the part of his honest landlord, Brown badeadieu to the banks of the Liddel and the hospitality of Charlie'sHope.

title: Guy Mannering, Or, the Astrologer - Complete
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: And now, gudewife, I maun ride, to get to theLiddel or it be dark, for your Waste has but a kittle character,ye ken yoursell.'

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 02
author: Alexander Leighton
snippet: Anextraordinary lesson may be read on the banks of the Liddel and theEsk--there is a strange eloquence in the silence of these quiet dales.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 02
author: Alexander Leighton
snippet: Anextraordinary lesson may be read on the banks of the Liddel and theEsk--there is a strange eloquence in the silence of these quiet dales.

title: The Edinburgh gazetteer, or geographical dictionary ...
snippet: It is situated in apleasant country, on the banks of the riverEsk or Liddel, over which there is a goodstone bridge.

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: This letter mentioned that the moment the blaze, which wasthe signal of invasion, was seen, the mountaineers hastenedto their rendezvous, and those of Liddesdale swam the Liddelriver to reach it.
